e4: Switching to the new policy promotes ethical financial reporting and transparency by eliminating deliberate bias. This reduces the risk of legal issues and investigations, enhancing corporate credibility and investor trust. While some investors may initially misinterpret the change, clear communication can mitigate misunderstandings and align investor expectations with actual performance.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness, ensuring that all stakeholders have access to truthful and clear information. It should avoid deliberate biases or manipulations and consider the impact on all investors, including those less sophisticated. Ethical policies must comply with regulations and maintain high standards of corporate integrity, fostering long-term trust and confidence.
e6: What communication strategies will be employed to ensure all investors understand the change in reporting policy? How will the shift to unbiased reporting financially impact the company and investor perception in the short and long term? Has there been any analysis on the effects of potential legal risks under the current policy?
